monuments.name: Hawa Mahal
monuments.info: The iconic 'Palace of Winds' in Jaipur, featuring 953 small windows and stunning pink sandstone architecture from 1799.

monuments.name: Amber Fort
monuments.info: A magnificent hilltop fortress overlooking Maota Lake, known for its artistic Hindu style elements and mirror work.

monuments.name: Mattancherry Palace
monuments.info: Also known as Dutch Palace, featuring beautiful murals depicting scenes from the Ramayana and Mahabharata.

monuments.name: Padmanabhaswamy Temple
monuments.info: A magnificent temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu, renowned for its Dravidian architecture and historical significance.

monuments.name: Valley of Flowers
monuments.info: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, this alpine valley blooms with rare and exotic flowers during monsoon season.

monuments.name: Kedarnath Temple
monuments.info: One of the twelve Jyotirlingas, located at 3,583m altitude in the Garhwal Himalayan range.

monuments.name: Basilica of Bom Jesus
monuments.info: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, this 16th-century church houses the sacred relics of St. Francis Xavier.

monuments.name: Se Cathedral
monuments.info: The largest church in Asia, built in Portuguese-Manueline architectural style with a golden bell known as 'Golden Bell'.

monuments.name: Brihadeeswarar Temple
monuments.info: A UNESCO World Heritage Site in Thanjavur, this 1000-year-old temple is a masterpiece of Dravidian architecture.

monuments.name: Mahabalipuram
monuments.info: A UNESCO World Heritage Site featuring ancient rock-cut temples and sculptures dating back to the 7th century.

monuments.name: Rumtek Monastery
monuments.info: One of the most significant monasteries in Sikkim, known for its stunning architecture and Buddhist relics.

monuments.name: Pemayangtse Monastery
monuments.info: A 300-year-old monastery with rich history, offering panoramic views of the Himalayas.

monuments.name: Shimla Christ Church
monuments.info: A neo-Gothic church built in 1857, featuring beautiful stained glass windows representing faith, hope, charity, and patience.

monuments.name: Hidimba Devi Temple
monuments.info: An ancient cave temple in Manali dedicated to Hidimbi Devi, surrounded by a cedar forest and featuring unique pagoda-style architecture.

monuments.name: Ajanta Caves
monuments.info: UNESCO World Heritage Site with 30 rock-cut caves featuring ancient Buddhist paintings and sculptures from the 2nd century BCE.

monuments.name: Ellora Caves
monuments.info: A UNESCO World Heritage Site with 34 caves representing Buddhist, Hindu, and Jain temples carved from rock between the 6th-10th centuries.
